image.altText: Dead pink fish and pink chunks floating in an open ocean fish pen.

props.synopsis: The peak body for salmon farming acknowledges the community impact of mass salmon mortalities and fatty chunks washing ashore on Tasmanian beaches, calling it a "concerning time" and saying the industry will be making changes.

title.children: Salmon industry apologises for 'unprecedented' mortality event, pledges changes

image.altText: A dozen King Island Dairy double brie cheese wheels splayed with their labels showing.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian cheesemaker King Island Dairy is sold after more than a year on the market and the threat of closure hanging over it.

title.children: 'Blessed are the cheesemakers': King Island rejoices as dairy finds new buyer

image.altText: An up close shot of a wind turbine with other wind turbines on the top of green mountain ridges

props.synopsis: The federal environment minister's long-awaited decision on granting approval for a 100-turbine wind farm on the Bass Strait island will be delayed again, until after the federal election.

title.children: Plibersek delays Robbins Island wind farm decision until after election

image.altText: An aerial photo of Hobart's CBD and Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: Concern is growing among club presidents and the broader public over the construction timeline of the proposed home of the Tasmania Devils. Here's what needs to happen to keep things on track.

title.children: Construction hasn't started on Hobart's stadium. But that's not an issue — yet

image.altText: A man with medium-length hair wearing a blue t-shirt smiles while sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: Family and jury members endure distressing photos of an alleged murder victim, and his cause of death, during a murder trial in Tasmania's Supreme Court.

title.children: Jury shown photos of alleged murder victim's body, 'ransacked' home

image.altText: A Tasmanian devil hunched near a residential toilet

props.synopsis: A snake catcher uses tactics usually reserved for unwanted reptiles after a Tasmanian devil took shelter from pursuing dogs behind a toilet — while a woman was sitting down.

title.children: Tasmanian devil gives woman on toilet a big surprise

image.altText: Tents and protesters outside Parliament House in Hobart

props.synopsis: It's been 20 years since the government's last land return to First Nations people in Tasmania. Will there ever be reconciliation and treaty? Airlie Ward discusses the issue with journalist Adam Holmes.

title.children: TassieCast: What's happening with reconciliation in Tasmania?

image.altText: A weather map showing the forecast rain for NSW and Queensland over a five-day period.

props.synopsis: With Tropical Cyclone Alfred nearing the coastline, here's a day-by-day outline of the impacts to expect on the ground in south-east Queensland and northern New South Wales.

title.children: A breakdown of what to expect from Tropical Cyclone Alfred in coming days

image.altText: Tigers head coach Benji Marshall looks on

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall cuts an annoyed figure after watching his side lose a tight round one match against Newcastle. Follow live.

title.children: 'We should've won': Tigers go from standing ovation to blowing second half lead

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 68' TRY: Souths retake lead as Isaiah Tass scores
53' TRY: Dolphins take the lead, Souths errors adding up

image.altText: Star Casino

props.synopsis: Embattled casino group Star Entertainment will stay alive, for now, after securing a $53 million lifeline in return for selling its 50 per cent stake in the new Brisbane casino.

title.children: Star to hand over Brisbane casino to Hong Kong investors in $53m deal

image.altText: Several people holding down a teenage boy in an aeroplane

props.synopsis: Questions are raised over how a 17-year-old boy was allegedly able to evade security at Avalon Airport and board a flight with a loaded shotgun.

title.children: 'I've got bombs in my bag', 17yo allegedly told plane passengers

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: NSW Police charge veteran broadcaster Alan Jones with an additional offence relating to an 11th alleged victim.

title.children: Alan Jones hit with new charge relating to alleged 11th victim

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy gestures as he talks to media

props.synopsis: Volodymyr Zelenkskyy says he hopes discussions to end the three-year war between Russia and Ukraine will be "meaningful".

title.children: Zelenskyy says US and Ukraine to hold talks in Saudi Arabia

image.altText: A pregnant woman standing in front of a birthing pool, has long hair, wears a white striped dress.

props.synopsis: The threat of a cyclone can be stressful, but imagine preparing to give birth with a storm approaching.

title.children: Expectant mother ready for homebirth despite Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A satellite image shows clouds forming a tropical cyclone off the coast of Australia

props.synopsis: Weather satellites are capturing the formation and movements of Tropical Cyclone Alfred as it approaches Queensland's south-eastern coastline.

title.children: The view from space of Cyclone Alfred nearing coastlines

image.altText: emergency helicopter and amulance at the scene at Gunyah Beach, near Bundeena, after a shark attack

props.synopsis: The woman, aged in her 50s, was pulled from the water by onlookers when she was bitten by the shark at about 1:30pm on Friday.

title.children: Woman attacked by shark at beach in Sydney's south

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios appears pensive as he sits on his bench courtside

props.synopsis: Injury-plagued Nick Kyrgios retires hurt from his first-round match at Indian Wells in a major blow for his comeback.

title.children: Kyrgios comeback derailed again as injury forces Indian Wells retirement

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman wearing white kisses a man kneeling down near a large ship

props.synopsis: It was an emotional reunion for a Lithuanian man who had tried to row from the US to Australia, but had to be rescued off Queensland after being caught in the wrath of Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Cross-Pacific rower rescued from cyclone's fury embraces wife on solid ground

image.altText: pension money

props.synopsis: There will likely be a flurry of insurance claims lodged after Cyclone Alfred, so here's what the experts recommend you do before, during and after the storm to make sure you're protected.

title.children: How to give cyclone insurance claims the best chance of being approved

image.altText: A woman stands and watches huge waves crash on the shore of a beach

props.synopsis: Video and images of high winds and wild weather is emerging online as Cyclone Alfred looms over the east coast. But in between the real and terrifying visuals lurk fakes designed to fool the public. Here's how to spot them.

title.children: Before you believe that cyclone video, ask yourself these questions

image.altText: James Hayward stands in front of microphones outside the District Court

props.synopsis: Prosecutors drop all charges against former Nationals MP James Hayward, who spent more than a year in prison after he was convicted of child sexual abuse.

title.children: Child sex charges dropped against ex-Nationals MP James Hayward

image.altText: A view shows debris streaking through the sky, after SpaceX's Starship spacecraft tumbled and exploded in space

props.synopsis: SpaceX's Starship spacecraft tumbles and explodes in space just minutes after lifting off from Texas.

title.children: SpaceX loses control of Starship in second testing failure this year

image.altText: A boy with an amputated arm wrapped up sits in an orange chair

props.synopsis: The ABC meets some of the children evacuated from the war-ravaged strip, seeking medical treatment in Jordan.

title.children: 'I am the only man left': 13yo wants to get well for his family

image.altText: A young basketballer on court, smiling

props.synopsis: Alier Riak's parents have remembered their son as a talented basketballer and role model for children.

title.children: Brothers jailed for 25 years for fatal stabbing of young basketballer in Melbourne

image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has yet to respond after the Australian Financial Review reported he had flown to a private event at the Sydney home of venue magnate Justin Hemmes on Tuesday. It is understood the opposition leader is back home in Brisbane.

title.children: Albanese says Dutton's Sydney trip amid cyclone approach 'a matter for him'

image.altText: The flags of the US, Canada and Mexico side by side

props.synopsis: The exemption, covering the two largest US trading partners, will expire on April 2.

title.children: Trump postpones 25pc tariffs on some goods from Canada and Mexico

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair, wearing a pink top and navy jacket, standing across the street from a historic hotel.

props.synopsis: Media personality Ali Clarke has shared how she was verbally abused and refused a ride by a taxi driver in Adelaide.

title.children: Radio presenter refused taxi ride, abused by driver in Adelaide

image.altText: A composite image of Roger Cook and Libby Mettam

props.synopsis: Who's funding the WA state election? Which seats are in play? How could the opposition win? We dive into the numbers behind the WA state election.

title.children: Unveiling the shadow election campaign playing out in WA

image.altText: Two women standing in a vet clinic in blue scrubs.

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast animal surgery is stocked with extra generator fuel, clean water, plenty of food and even cushions for pet owners to camp out on, as the weather system approaches the coast.

title.children: Vet prepares mattresses for pet owners as Cyclone Alfred nears coast

image.altText: Illustration of a human silhouette with brain, injection pen and fast food.

props.synopsis: People on Ozempic and other GLP-1 agonist drugs commonly report they no longer have constant, incessant thoughts about food. This is how the drugs work.

title.children: How Ozempic blunts food cravings — and our hankering for salty and sweet

image.altText: NSW Police officers speaking to a man out the front of a mosque in western Sydney.

props.synopsis: An alleged threat of mass violence against a Sydney mosque sparked the arrest of a WA teenager, but did not breach Instagram's community guidelines.

title.children: Calls for action after Meta says 'Christchurch 2.0' comment not a breach

image.altText: The pope, dressed all in white, makes a blessing gesture with one hand.

props.synopsis: In the message, the pontiff thanked those at the service for their prayers and support.

title.children: Pope Francis releases audio message from hospital

image.altText: Queen Omega looks at camera with colourful braids in her hair

props.synopsis: After 25 years in the game, Queen Omega is enjoying her biggest success yet.

title.children: After hundreds of millions of views, Queen Omega finally visits Australia
